title: Poster, "Hi!/Ciao!/Salut! for International Design Center Nagoya: Kato", late 20th century
title_raw: "Hi!/Ciao!/Salut! for International Design Center Nagoya: Kato"
signed: Imprinted in black, lower left: "designed by Syuzo kato/ in collaboration with Toppan Printing co., ltd. Takeo co., ltd."
inscribed: Imprinted in black, lower left: "International Design Center NAGOYA Inc."  Imprinted in black, right of credit line: logo (profile of bird)/ IdcN"
description:
Poster for International Design Center in Nagoya.  Use of repetition in various sizes of silhouette of man in three-quarter backview wearing hat and suit saluting like soldier.  Concentration of repetition at top with partial or complete image.  Comic stripe text cloud wraps around figure at knee level.  Text is variation of "Hi!" in English, French 
("Salut!"), Italian ("Ciao!"), and Japanese (in Japanese character).  Large repetition of silhouette dominates at center and top half of silhouette at bottom edge.  Name and credit across bottom.

tombstone.epitaph: Poster, "Hi!/Ciao!/Salut! for International Design Center Nagoya: Kato", late 20th century. offset lithography. Gift of Unknown Donor. 1996-129-2.
